io.bitxor.sdk.api

Interface TokenRestrictionTransactionService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TokenRestrictionTransactionServiceImpl

    public interface TokenRestrictionTransactionService
    Service that helps clients setting up and updating token restrictions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      io.reactivex.Observable<TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId tokenId, java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey, UnresolvedAddress targetAddress, java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue)
      Create a TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token address restriction.
      io.reactivex.Observable<TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId tokenId, java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey, java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue, TokenRestrictionType restrictionType)
      Create a TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token global restriction.

    • Method Detail

      • createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory

        io.reactivex.Observable<TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId tokenId,
                                                                                                                   java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey,
                                                                                                                   java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue,
                                                                                                                   TokenRestrictionType restrictionType)
        Create a TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token global restriction.

        This service checks the current global restriction value using rest and set the corresponding previousRestrictionType and previousRestrictionValue so an update can be performed.

        When using aliases, the service will resolve them in order to query the token restriction rest endpoint. This could add some overhead. If you know the real token id, it's recommended to use it.

        Parameters:
        tokenId - the token id or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it in order to retrieve the current global restriction value.
        restrictionKey - Restriction key
        restrictionValue - New restriction value
        restrictionType - New restriction type
        Returns:
        TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory of the transaction ready to be announced.

      • createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory

        io.reactivex.Observable<TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId tokenId,
                                                                                                                     java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey,
                                                                                                                     UnresolvedAddress targetAddress,
                                                                                                                     java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue)
        Create a TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token address restriction.

        This service checks the current address restriction value using rest and set the corresponding previousRestrictionValue so an update can be performed.

        When using aliases, the service will resolve them in order to query the token restriction rest endpoint. This could add some overhead. If you know the real token id and target address, it's recommended to use them.

        Parameters:
        tokenId - the token id or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it * in order to retrieve the current token address restriction value.
        restrictionKey - Restriction key
        targetAddress - the target address or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it in order to retrieve the current token address restriction value.
        restrictionValue - New restriction value
        Returns:
        TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory object without previous restriction data
